Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Program: Access and awareness for public support services
Agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services; Chicago Department of Public Health
Description: Community-based navigation resources for public services
Detail Description: Provides community-based navigation resources to ensure residents are aware of and have access to public services, including the creation of a 211 system
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Office of Budget and Management
Description: Grants for students and households to cover school supplies
Detail Description: Provides flexible grants for Chicago students/households to cover school supplies, food, and other essentials that are required for student support
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events
Description: Targeted relief for individual artists and cultural organizations not eligible for other federal relief programs
Detail Description: Targeted relief for individual artists, creative workers and cultural organizations, both nonprofit and for profit, not eligible for other federal relief programs. Funds will be administered through a combination of grants, technical assistance support, and creative workforce development programs.
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Program: Increase access to broadband internet connection
Detail Description: Expands Chicago Connected by funding neighborhood-scale broadband and leverage City assets to increase broadband affordability in communities
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: Chicago General Obligation Bond
Program: Increase access to broadband internet connection
Detail Description: Expands Chicago Connected by funding neighborhood-scale broadband and leverage City assets to increase broadband affordability in communities

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Program: Targeted financial and legal assistance for underserved residents
Agency: Chicago Department of Family and Support Services, Department of Business Affairs and Consumer Protection
Description: Financial assistance programs for underserved communities, including monthly cash assistance
Detail Description: The Resiliency Fund 2.0 will provide one-time, $500 relief payments to up to 25,500 low-income residents who have been negatively impacted by COVID-19 but faced barriers to qualifying for prior federal stimulus payments. The four focus populations for the fund are domestic workers, undocumented residents, and households with dependent youth and dependent adults who were not included in federal stimulus payments.
source_name: City of Chicago ARPA Recovery Plan

Funding Source: Chicago General Obligation Bond
Detail Description: Complete plumbing and water reconnection repairs for households unable to make repairs necessary to access clean municipal water sources

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Purchasing and retiring medical debt of income-eligible patients in Cook County hospitals
Detail Description: Cook County will support the development of a Community Information Exchange (CIE) for suburban Cook County and the City of Chicago to enhance the 211 system already being collaboratively developed by Cook County, the City of Chicago and a range of partners. A CIE is an interconnected and linked network of health, behavioral health, human, and social service providers that share information and coordinate services so that an individual receives the whole person care they need to be healthy and thrive, regardless of how they initially enter services, creating a “no wrong door” access to the social and health services system.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Development of a Community Information Exchange (CIE) to enhance in-development 211 system
Detail Description: Cook County Legal Aid for Housing and Debt (CCLAHD) helps residents resolve eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues pre-court and during the court process. CCLAHD provides free legal aid, mediation services, case management, and connections for tenants and landlords dealing with evictions, property owners who are behind on their mortgage payments or property taxes, and creditors and debtors with issues related to consumer debt.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Legal aid and case management services for residents facing eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues
Detail Description: ARPA funding to support the Cook County Legal Aid for Housing and Debt program, which assists residents dealing with eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues. CCLAHD helps residents resolve eviction, foreclosure, consumer debt, and tax deed issues pre-court and during the court process. CCLAHD provides free legal aid, mediation services, case management, and connections  for tenants and landlords dealing with evictions, property owners who are behind on their mortgage payments or property taxes, and creditors and debtors with issues related to consumer debt.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Program: Cook County Residential Water Conservation and Energy Efficiency Program
Detail Description: The program will increase housing affordability for residents by reducing utility costs. Specifically, the project identifies residents for home energy and water assessments and implement energy efficiency improvements and water conservation measures (such as window replacement, roof repairs, insulation, air sealing, HVAC improvements, LED lighting, energyefficient windows and doors, installing low-flow water appliances and repairing leaks).

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Detail Description: The Cook County Water Affordability Program will provide water utility bill payment assistance to help households suffering from income loss and mounting bills during the pandemic. The program will reduce uncollectable debt for municipal water utilities. The anticipated focus of the program is on communities with a high-water burden, meaning that the household spends a significantly larger portion of their income on the water and sewer bill.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Description: Recurring monthly unrestricted payments to a to-be-defined set of residents for at least 12 months to improve participants’ long-term economic stability
Detail Description: The Cook County Guaranteed Income Program will provide recurring monthly unrestricted payments to a to-be-defined set of residents for at least 12 months to improve participants’ long-term economic stability. The Guaranteed Income Program builds on the demonstrated success of guaranteed income programs in other jurisdictions in increasing residents’ financial stability and improving their health outcomes. Cook County’s program will include a research evaluation component to help the County better understand participant impacts.

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Agency: Cook County Department of Veterans Affairs
Description: Establishing a fund to provide grants for community-based veteran service organizations and veteran-owned businesses
Detail Description: The Department of Veterans Affairs will establish a fund to provide grants to community-based veteran service organizations and veteran-owned businesses. The Veteran Grant Program will begin with a seed of $5 million for grants in the following areas: Program Enhancement; Capital Improvements; and Small Business Development.

Funding Source: CARES
Program: Child Care and Development Block Grant
Agency: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
Detail Description: These funds supplement general revenue funds for child care assistance for low-income families. The supplemental funding must be used for activities authorized under the CCDBG Act that prevent, prepare for, and respond to the Covid-19 pandemic.
source_name: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services 2020 CARES Act CCDBG Supplemental Allocations

Funding Source: ARPA
Program: Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program
Agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
Detail Description: The Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) provides assistance in managing costs associated with home energy bills, energy crises, weatherization and energy-related minor home repairs
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

Funding Source: CARES

Agency: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
Detail Description: The Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) provides assistance in managing costs associated with home energy bills, energy crises, weatherization and energy-related minor home repairs
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

Funding Source: ARPA
Program: Low Income Household Water Assistance Program
Agency: Illinois Department of Commerce and Economic Opportunity
Description: Assists low-income households with affordable drinking water and wastewater services
Detail Description: The Low Income Household Water Assistance Program will assist low-income households, particularly those with the lowest incomes and that pay a high proportion of household income for drinking water and wastewater services, by providing funds to owners or operators of public water systems or treatment works to reduce arrearages of and rates charged to low-income households for water and wastewater services.
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget

Funding Source: ARPA State and Local Fiscal Recovery Funds
Detail Description: These funds support implementation of extended unemployment insurance
source_name: State of Illinois Executive Office of the Governor Governor's Office of Management and Budget
